goal.en: This advanced-level course aims to foster your comprehension of qualitative research methods. It concentrates on providing a succinct overview of the conceptual and methodological considerations associated with conducting qualitative research, with a specific focus on applying these methods within the realm of information systems. The course underscores the potential for qualitative, non-statistical research in Management Information Systems (MIS) to yield unexpected and profound insights into individuals and systems. Upon completion of the course, you will have a well-defined project, a clear understanding of the necessary tasks, and the ability to adeptly navigate the challenges posed by qualitative methods, including unforeseen events.
goal.ch: This advanced-level course aims to foster your comprehension of qualitative research methods. It concentrates on providing a succinct overview of the conceptual and methodological considerations associated with conducting qualitative research, with a specific focus on applying these methods within the realm of information systems. The course underscores the potential for qualitative, non-statistical research in Management Information Systems (MIS) to yield unexpected and profound insights into individuals and systems. Upon completion of the course, you will have a well-defined project, a clear understanding of the necessary tasks, and the ability to adeptly navigate the challenges posed by qualitative methods, including unforeseen events.

content.en:
Module 1: Basic Concepts
Module 2: Research Strategy and Research Design
Module 3: Data Collection Methods
Module 4: Managing, Analyzing, and Interpreting Data
Module 5: Evaluation, Writing, and the Future of Qualitative Research
